intro: Peucedanum chrysanthum, commonly known as the golden cow parsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a slender, branched stem and produces small, aromatic seeds. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and often ornamental addition to natural habitats.
